definition: see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: The horse's strides are shorter than at the other canters, without losing elasticity and cadence.
sentences.chinese: 马的步幅比其他几种跑步较短，但却不失弹性与节奏。

sentences.english: You could find this to be an exciting change of pace.
sentences.chinese: 这样你会发现节奏会发生使你异常兴奋的变化。

sentences.english: Alter the pitch, pan, tempo, volumes etc.
sentences.chinese: 改变音高，声像，节奏，数量等。

sentences.english: Nesta looked off-pace over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 内斯塔在周末看上去跟不上节奏。

sentences.english: This busy pace accompanies lots of cash flow.
sentences.chinese: 这种繁忙的节奏意味着现金流转量很大。

sentences.english: In my experience, faster music has performed much better than slow.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的经验，快节奏的音乐比慢节奏的好。

sentences.english: In my experience, faster music has performed much better than slow.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的经验，快节奏的音乐比慢节奏的好。

sentences.english: After dancing merengue, the DJ might play slow music. Some people will dance;
sentences.chinese: 梅伦格舞结束后，DJ可能会放些慢节奏音乐。

sentences.english: The dancing figure expresses the solidness and the silence of the stone with rhymes.
sentences.chinese: 跳舞的人物表现出具有节奏感的石头的坚硬与沉默。

sentences.english: The CSRC would "adjust the size and pace" of flotations while the pilot was introduced.
sentences.chinese: 证监会将在试点期间，调整浮选的规模和节奏。

sentences.english: This story is less about politics and more about pace.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事跟政治关系不大，倒是和节奏有关。

sentences.english: The pace questions get asked, answered, liked etc. is too fast on Quora.
sentences.chinese: 在Quora，提问题和回答问题的节奏都太快了。

sentences.english: Step 7Add pacing and excitement to your story by sprinkling it with dialog.
sentences.chinese: 通过对白来调节故事的节奏，增加兴奋点。

sentences.english: And just to keep the rhythm going, we will have a test on Tuesday, the weekly quiz.
sentences.chinese: 保持节奏，我们周二将有场考试，周测。

sentences.english: The bus slopped  and that made me sleepy.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车发出有节奏的声音使我昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: Some people just don't have enough rhythm to boogie.
sentences.chinese: 有些人没有足够的节奏感跳布吉舞。

definition: to catch up with/to keep pace with
matching/fitting in with/compatible with/to correspond/to fit/to conform to/rapport/to coordinate with/to act in concert with/to cooperate/to become man and wife/to combine parts of machine
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
(music) note/phonetic component of a Chinese character/phonetic symbol/phonogram
